Help us congratulate Traci Jones from Lakeshore Elementary School as this year's Iredell-Statesville Schools Teacher of the Year! Mrs. Jones, who is a National Board Certified Teacher, has been working as a fourth or fifth-grade teacher at Lakeshore Elementary School since she began her career in the district in 2004. In her portfolio, Mrs. Jones stated, "I truly believe as a teacher, you teach the whole child. Some of my greatest accomplishments are setting forth to reach every child that has entered my room and giving each one a safe, positive place to reach his or her potential."

Congratulations Mrs. Traci Jones!

Join us on Thursday, August 27th at 6:00 p.m. as we host a Canvas Parent University Zoom session. During this session, you will learn how to become a Parent Observer, gain understanding in your role, and how to navigate Canvas through the web and the Canvas Parent App. You will also be able to ask Canvas related questions so that you are prepared to support your students as they learn in blended and remote learning environments.

Canvas Parent University is open to parents or guardians of students in grades 4th through 12th, but there is a 300 person capacity. To reserve your spot today, complete this form (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSe9HvC0KqlA0wZHQ-VzKy2MvHAaUM0wPveHerbb9TSpIcWGYA/viewform). We ask that you limit your registration to one per household as our session is extremely limited. If necessary, we will host another session at 7:00 p.m.

For more information about PowerSchool, Canvas or Canvas Parent University, click on the "Parent/Student" portal from any of our websites and click the Parent Portal button.

On the I-SS website, click on the Enroll button in the upper right corner, select the right icon for returning students, and enter the SnapCode. Enter your account information or create an account if you do not have one.

Thank you for your assistance!

Originally, Iredell-Statesville Schools planned to hold a commencement ceremony for each respective high school on August 1, 2020. Unfortunately, we are unable to move forward with those plans. Based on the recent state of COVID-19 in North Carolina, the August 1 commencement events have been cancelled.

Superintendent Jeff James stated, “We could never have imagined back in May that COVID-19 numbers would continue to rise here in NC late into the summer. Collectively we have agreed that holding large commencement ceremonies on August 1 could result in further spreading COVID in Iredell County. We are saddened to make this announcement, and hopeful that our 2020 graduates and their families support this decision.”

WBTV's Molly Grantham
May 21 at 2:55 PM ·

Hanna Ball just showed up to her high school graduation at South Iredell High School socially distanced from everyone by riding on her horse, and I am now officially obsessed with this 17-year-old’s bold, instantly-memorable attitude.

Hanna’s family tells me she has ridden horses since a young girl. She participates in rodeos, FFA and 4H club. The rain held off yesterday long enough to get the horse loaded and hauled to a parking lot down the street from the school. She then rode her horse down the street and up to the stage. There she got off to walk across the stage and receive her diploma.

The staff played the Lone Ranger theme song in the background instead of “Pomp and Circumstance”.

With so many things canceled for seniors, this seems a wildly-needed exciting moment for not just Hanna and her family, but anyone else who either saw it live or is watching here now seeing one high schooler making lemonade out of our COVID-lemons.

Few more photos below in comments.

-Molly

PS: The Lone Ranger. The school played The Lone Ranger for her. Obsessed.

Learn how and when to use consequences for misbehavior
Learn how and when to use praise
Learn to make daily life more pleasant and relaxed around the house
